entry.title: Milli-spinner thrombectomy
entry.content:
Milli-spinner thrombectomy

The milli-spinner thrombectomy facilitates fast, complete clot removal by using spinning-induced compression and shear forces to mechanically modify the clot microstructure through densifying the fibrin network and releasing red blood cells, thus reducing clot volume.

  • Yilong Chang
  • Shuai Wu
  • Ruike Renee Zhao
Article04 Jun 2025

entry.title: Molecular gradients shape synaptic specificity of a visuomotor transformation
entry.content:
Molecular gradients shape synaptic specificity of a visuomotor transformation

Gradients of cell recognition molecules wire a sensorimotor interface in Drosophila.

  • Mark Dombrovski
  • Yixin Zang
  • S. Lawrence Zipursky
ArticleOpen Access04 Jun 2025

entry.title: A multidimensional distributional map of future reward in dopamine neurons
entry.content:
A multidimensional distributional map of future reward in dopamine neurons

An algorithm called time–magnitude reinforcement learning (TMRL) extends distributional reinforcement learning to take account of reward time and magnitude, and behavioural and neurophysiological experiments in mice suggest that midbrain dopamine neurons use TMRL-like computations.

  • Margarida Sousa
  • Pawel Bujalski
  • Joseph J. Paton
Article04 Jun 2025

entry.title: Integrated photonic source of Gottesman–Kitaev–Preskill qubits
entry.content:
Integrated photonic source of Gottesman–Kitaev–Preskill qubits

An ultra-low-loss integrated photonic chip fabricated on a customized multilayer silicon nitride 300-mm wafer platform, coupled over fibre with high-efficiency photon number resolving detectors, is used to generate Gottesman–Kitaev–Preskill qubit states.

  • M. V. Larsen
  • J. E. Bourassa
  • D. H. Mahler
ArticleOpen Access04 Jun 2025

entry.title: Maternal iron deficiency causes male-to-female sex reversal in mouse embryos
entry.content:
Maternal iron deficiency causes male-to-female sex reversal in mouse embryos

Iron-deficient conditions in pregnant mice can cause XY mouse embryos to develop female rather than male genitalia, revealing that iron metabolism has a role in determining male sex in mice.

  • Naoki Okashita
  • Ryo Maeda
  • Makoto Tachibana
Article04 Jun 2025

entry.title: Coordination environments of Pt single-atom catalysts from NMR signatures
entry.content:
Coordination environments of Pt single-atom catalysts from NMR signatures

This study presents a nuclear magnetic resonance-based method to determine local structure and bonding of Pt single-atom catalysts.

  • Jonas Koppe
  • Alexander V. Yakimov
  • Christophe Copéret
ArticleOpen Access04 Jun 2025

entry.title: Observation of string breaking on a (2 + 1)D Rydberg quantum simulator
entry.content:
Observation of string breaking on a (2 + 1)D Rydberg quantum simulator

A quantum simulation of a (2 + 1)-dimensional lattice gauge theory is carried out on a quantum computer working with neutral atoms trapped by optical tweezers in a Kagome geometry.

  • Daniel González-Cuadra
  • Majd Hamdan
  • Alexei Bylinskii
Article04 Jun 2025

entry.title: Ancient DNA reveals a two-clanned matrilineal community in Neolithic China
entry.content:
Ancient DNA reveals a two-clanned matrilineal community in Neolithic China

Analysis of ancient DNA, stable isotope data and archaeological evidence from the Fujia archaeological site in eastern China suggests it was populated by a matrilineal Neolithic community between 2750 and 2500 bc.

  • Jincheng Wang
  • Shi Yan
  • Chao Ning
ArticleOpen Access04 Jun 2025

entry.title: Visualizing dynamics of charges and strings in (2 + 1)D lattice gauge theories
entry.content:
Visualizing dynamics of charges and strings in (2 + 1)D lattice gauge theories

In a quantum simulation of a (2+1)D lattice gauge theory using a superconducting quantum processor, the dynamics of strings reveal the transition from deconfined to confined excitations as the effective electric field is increased.

  • T. A. Cochran
  • B. Jobst
  • P. Roushan
ArticleOpen Access04 Jun 2025

entry.title: Old carbon routed from land to the atmosphere by global river systems
entry.content:
Old carbon routed from land to the atmosphere by global river systems

Using a global database of the radiocarbon content of rivers combining new and published measurements, isotopic mass balance suggests that about 60% of river CO2 emissions are derived from millennial or older carbon sources.

  • Joshua F. Dean
  • Gemma Coxon
  • Robert G. Hilton
ArticleOpen Access04 Jun 2025

entry.title: Warming accelerates global drought severity
entry.content:
Warming accelerates global drought severity

Increased atmospheric evaporative demand in recent years has increased drought severity by an average of 40% globally across both dry and wet regions, and the trend is likely to continue under future warming scenarios.

  • Solomon H. Gebrechorkos
  • Justin Sheffield
  • Simon J. Dadson
ArticleOpen Access04 Jun 2025

entry.title: CREM is a regulatory checkpoint of CAR and IL-15 signalling in NK cells
entry.content:
CREM is a regulatory checkpoint of CAR and IL-15 signalling in NK cells

The transcription factor CREM is a pivotal regulator of NK cell function, making CREM a valuable target to increase the efficacy of anticancer immunotherapies based on this cell population and chimeric antigen receptors.

  • Hind Rafei
  • Rafet Basar
  • Katayoun Rezvani
ArticleOpen Access04 Jun 2025

entry.title: Probing condensate microenvironments with a micropeptide killswitch
entry.content:
Probing condensate microenvironments with a micropeptide killswitch

Targeting a non-natural micropeptide ‘killswitch’ to several biomolecular condensates altered condensate compositions and revealed condensate functions in human cells

  • Yaotian Zhang
  • Ida Stöppelkamp
  • Denes Hnisz
ArticleOpen Access04 Jun 2025

entry.title: Loss of colonic fidelity enables multilineage plasticity and metastasis
entry.content:
Loss of colonic fidelity enables multilineage plasticity and metastasis

The chromatin-remodelling enzyme ATRX and the transcription factor HNF4A are identified as pivotal regulators of colonic epithelial identity, with roles in metastasis in colorectal cancer.

  • Patrizia Cammareri
  • Michela Raponi
  • Kevin B. Myant
ArticleOpen Access04 Jun 2025

entry.title: A soft-clamped topological waveguide for phonons
entry.content:
A soft-clamped topological waveguide for phonons

A substantial reduction of losses in a phononic waveguide can be achieved by soft clamping, through which phonons can be guided through very sharp turns with losses accounting for less than one phonon in a million.

  • Xiang Xi
  • Ilia Chernobrovkin
  • Albert Schliesser
Article04 Jun 2025

entry.title: Multi-timescale reinforcement learning in the brain
entry.content:
Multi-timescale reinforcement learning in the brain

Individual dopaminergic neurons encode future rewards over distinct temporal horizons.

  • Paul Masset
  • Pablo Tano
  • Naoshige Uchida
Article04 Jun 2025

entry.title: Increased CSF drainage by non-invasive manipulation of cervical lymphatics
entry.content:
Increased CSF drainage by non-invasive manipulation of cervical lymphatics

The outflow pathway of cerebrospinal fluid into lymph nodes in the neck and how non-invasive mechanical stimulation can enhance drainage and restore impaired outflow in aged mice are explored.

  • Hokyung Jin
  • Jin-Hui Yoon
  • Gou Young Koh
ArticleOpen Access04 Jun 2025
